author: bridge-bot
content:
<CarlBeek> RollCall tomorrow 04/10 14:00 UTC.

Agenda: https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/1013

Topics of especial note:

- Alex Stokes will be hosting a discussion on BLS precompiles in the L1 EVM (https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2537)
- Toni Wahrstätter will be hosting a discussion on his & Vitalik's EIP on increasing L1 Calldata costs now that we have blobs. (https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-7623-increase-calldata-cost/18647)

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> added to the schedule, thanks Mamy

author: bridge-bot
content:
<mratsim> re EIP-2537, I have implementation concerns, and test vector needs related to subgroup checks. Will Anthony Sanso attend (cc <@539495253418180618> he is not part of this group chat) I'll add 2 proposals to the Ethereum magician topics ahead of time. (re @CarlBeek: RollCall tomorrow 04/10 14:00 UTC.

Agenda: https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/1013
Link: Posted in this channel just before the call


Topics of especial note:

- Alex Stokes will be hosting a discussion on BLS precompiles in the L1 EVM (https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2537)
- Toni Wahrstätter will be hosting a discussion on his & Vitalik's EIP on increasing L1 Calldata costs now that we have blobs. (https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-7623-increase-calldata-cost/18647))

author: bridge-bot
content:
<ralexstokes> PTAL: https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-2537-bls12-precompile-discussion-thread/4187/65?u=ralexstokes

im not sure ill be able to join the call tomorrow but we should get these questions sorted (re @mratsim: concerns: https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-2537-bls12-precompile-discussion-thread/4187/63?u=mratsim)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<mratsim> Yes I have a reply with 3 proposals,
1. no subgroup check, price like double-and-add like today, add test vectors. For G1 not a problem, endomorphism acceleration is even not needed beyond 2^10 sized MSM, the overhead is too large. This is the pragmatic approach. (no change to EIP)
2. enforce subgroup check. This is the misuse resistance approach
3. provide subgroup check, and clear cofactor separate primitives, so people can do it themselves, this is the performance and modularity approach, (re @ralexstokes: PTAL: https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-2537-bls12-precompile-discussion-thread/4187/65?u=ralexstokes

im not sure ill be able to join the call tomorrow but we should get these questions sorted)

author: bridge-bot
content: <mratsim> There is one caveat to 1 that I need to bench, it's MSM on G2, because endomorphism on G2 divides size by 4 so the perf gap is significantly larger

author: bridge-bot
content:
<mratsim> Another question is the pricing, EIP-7667 is a proposal to raise hash costs by 10x for snarkifying the EVM.
Do we need the same for elliptic curve precompiles?
This affects zkBridges, L3, verifying KZG in L2, zkCoprocessors on L2, ...

author: bridge-bot
content: <mratsim> on the other hand, there are techniques like Goblin Plonk, CycleFold and https://eprint.iacr.org/2022/596 that can accelerate EC in ZK
